title: Citation File Format
description: A file with citation metadata for software or datasets.

abstract.description: A description of the software or dataset.

cff-version.description: The version of CFF used for providing the citation metadata

message.description: A message to the (human) reader of the file to let them know what to do with the citation metadata
message.default: If you use this software, please cite it using the metadata from this file.

authors.description: The author(s) of the software or dataset.

cff-version.description: The version of CFF used for providing the citation metadata.

message.description: A message to the (human) reader of the file to let them know what to do with the citation metadata.
examples: If you use this software, please cite it using the metadata from this file.
Please cite this software using these metadata.
Please cite this software using the metadata from 'preferred-citation'.

contact.description: The contact person, group, company, etc. for the software or dataset.

date-released.description: The date the work has been released.

identifiers.description: The identifiers of the software or dataset.

license-url.description: The URL of the license text under which the software or dataset is licensed (only for non-standard licenses not included in the SPDX License List).

preferred-citation.description: When citing the work, cite this reference instead.

repository.description: The URL to the software or dataset in a repository (when the repository is neither a source code repository nor a build artifact repository).

repository-code.description: The URL to the software in a source code repository.

repository-artifact.description: The URL to the software in a build artifact/binary repository.

title.description: The name of the software or dataset.

url.description: The URL to a landing page/website for the software or dataset.

version.description: The version of the software or dataset.

commit.description: The (e.g., Git) commit hash or (e.g., Subversion) revision number of the work.

country.$comment: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes can be found at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1
country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for a country.

doi.description: The DOI of the work (i.e., 10.5281/zenodo.1003150, not the resolver URL http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.1003150).

orcid.description: Identifier for an author, see https://orcid.org.

name-particle.description: The person's name particle, e.g., a nobiliary particle or a preposition meaning 'of' or 'from' (for example 'von' in 'Alexander von Humboldt').

name-suffix.description: The person's name-suffix, e.g. 'Jr.' for Sammy Davis Jr. or 'III' for Frank Edwin Wright III.

oneOf.$comment: When there are multiple licenses, it is assumed their relationship is OR, not AND

license-enum.$comment: Use https://github.com/citation-file-format/get-spdx-licenses to update this enum in the future

entity.description: An entity, i.e., an institution, team, research group, company, conference, etc., as opposed to a single natural person.

date-start.description: The entity's starting date, e.g., when the entity is a conference.

date-end.description: The entity's ending date, e.g., when the entity is a conference.

location.description: The entity's location, e.g., when the entity is a conference.

collection-doi.description: The DOI of a collection containing the work.

collection-title.description: The title of a collection or proceedings.

conference.description: The conference where the work was presented.

contact.description: The contact person, group, company, etc. for a work.

copyright.description: The copyright information pertaining to the work.

data-type.description: The data type of a data set.

database.description: The name of the database where a work was accessed/is stored.

database-provider.description: The provider of the database where a work was accessed/is stored

date-accessed.description: The date the work was accessed.

date-downloaded.description: The date the work has been downloaded.

date-published.description: The date the work has been published.

date-released.description: The date the work has been released.

department.description: The department where a work has been produced.

editors-series.description: The editor(s) of a series in which a work has been published

end.description: The end page of the work.

entry.description: An entry in the collection that constitutes the work.

filename.description: The name of the electronic file containing the work.

format.description: The format in which a work is represented.

institution.description: The institution where a work has been produced or published.

issue.description: The issue of a periodical in which a work appeared.

issue-date.description: The publication date of the issue of a periodical in which a work appeared.

issue-title.description: The name of the issue of a periodical in which the work appeared.

journal.description: The name of the journal/magazine/newspaper/periodical where the work was published.

languages.description: The language identifier of the work according to ISO 639 language strings.

license-url.description: The URL of the license text under which the work is licensed (only for non-standard licenses not included in the SPDX License List).

loc-start.description: The line of code in the file where the work starts.

loc-end.description: The line of code in the file where the work ends

month.description: The month in which a work has been published.

number.description: The accession number for a work.

number-volumes.description: The number of volumes making up the collection in which the work has been published.

pages.description: The number of pages of the work.

patent-states.description: The states for which a patent is granted.

publisher.description: The publisher who has published the work.

recipients.description: The recipient of a personal communication.

repository.description: The URL to the work in a repository (when the repository is neither a source code repository nor a build artifact repository).

repository-code.description: The URL to the work in a source code repository.

repository-artifact.description: The URL to the work in a build artifact/binary repository.

scope.description: The scope of the reference, e.g., the section of the work it adheres to.

section.description: The section of a work that is referenced

senders.description: The sender(s) of a personal communication.

status.description: The publication status of the work.

start.description: The start page of the work.

term.description: The term being referenced if the work is a dictionary or encyclopedia.

thesis-type.description: The type of the thesis that is the work.

volume.description: The volume of the periodical in which a work appeared.

volume-title.description: The title of the volume in which the work appeared.

year.description: The year in which a work has been published.

year-original.description: The year of the original publication.

swh-identifier.$comment: Software Heritage identifiers are documented here: https://docs.softwareheritage.org/devel/swh-model/persistent-identifiers.html.
swh-identifier.description: The Software Heritage identifier (without further qualifiers such as origin, visit, anchor, path).
